resources.string:
Welcome to one of the Philippines’ oldest towns – Taal, Batangas!
 
	If there’s Taal Lake and Taal Volcano, then there’s Taal Heritage Town.
 
	Established in 1572 by Spanish missionaries, Taal is home to a number of esteemed Filipinos who played important roles in the Philippine revolution and in the shaping of our country.
 
	Take a walk around Taal and discover why this town was considered one of the most influential towns of its time.
 
	The Taal Heritage Trail begins at the Don Gregorio Agoncillo House and ends at the Gen. Anianas Diokno House. Along the way, stop by the Minor Basilica of St. Martin of Tours, Escuela Pia, Galleria Taal, Museo ni Leon Apacible, Galleria Orlina, and the Museo ni Marcela Agoncillo.
 
	Taal’s stories are ready to be told with the Heritage Information Adventure App!
 
	There’s more to discover.
